channel.title: Comments for Marcus Felling
channel.description: A blog about things I learn at the keyboard: DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Automation, to name a few....

item.title: Comment on How to reduce the size of your TFS/Azure DevOps Server collection databases by Edwin
item.dc:creator: Edwin
item.content:encoded:
In reply to tshk!.

I’ve had the same problem with test results. You could try the following. It worked for us. (After this it could take a while for the cleanup job actually deletes the runs)

#get test run
$tvsprojecturi = “https://azuredevopsserver/tfs/DefaultCollection/PROJECT”
#get top 5000 runs

$top5000Url = “$azuredevopsprojecturi/_apis/test/runs?api-version=6.0&`$top=5000”
$arti = invoke-restmethod $top5000Url -UseDefaultCredentials -Verbose

foreach($runUri in $arti.value.url)
{
#check first if you want to delete this run
Invoke-RestMethod -method Delete -Uri “$($runUri)?api-version=6.0” -UseDefaultCredentials -Verbose
}

item.title: Comment on Using Azure Test Plans with Playwright by Christelle
item.dc:creator: Christelle
item.description: Is there a workaround to use a Linux agent instead of a Windows agent?
item.content:encoded: Is there a workaround to use a Linux agent instead of a Windows agent?

item.title: Comment on Using Azure Test Plans with Playwright by Marcus
item.dc:creator: Marcus
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Christelle Klein.

Here is the YAML:
steps:
– powershell: |
pwsh playwright.ps1 install –with-deps

workingDirectory: ‘$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/_PlaywrightDotnet/PlaywrightTests/PlaywrightTests’
displayName: ‘Install Playwright browsers’

item.title: Comment on Using Azure Test Plans with Playwright by Christelle Klein
item.dc:creator: Christelle Klein
item.description: Thanks for the great tutorial! Just a question: What is in the Powershell script called "Install playwright browsers" from the release pipeline (Playwright .NET)?
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the great tutorial! Just a question:
What is in the Powershell script called “Install playwright browsers” from the release pipeline (Playwright .NET)?

item.title: Comment on Using Azure Test Plans with Playwright by Pete
item.dc:creator: Pete
item.description: Hi, your implementation is awesome. But is there any possibility, how to report results for each test step? As an example i have a Test code with 3 assertions (3 test steps in ADO) and i want to see in test case result, which step exactly failed/passed (e.g. step 2 will fail). Then, when i open the test case result, i will see that steps 1 & 3 were passed, and step 2 was failed. Then overall result of the test is failed
item.content:encoded:
Hi, your implementation is awesome. But is there any possibility, how to report results for each test step?
As an example i have a Test code with 3 assertions (3 test steps in ADO) and i want to see in test case result, which step exactly failed/passed (e.g. step 2 will fail).
Then, when i open the test case result, i will see that steps 1 & 3 were passed, and step 2 was failed. Then overall result of the test is failed

item.title: Comment on How to reduce the size of your TFS/Azure DevOps Server collection databases by tshk!
item.dc:creator: tshk!
item.description: It would be great to have an upgraded version of this post for DevOps 2022 onpremise. My DB weights 3tb.. im fighting to shrink it.. i have 2 millions of test results marked for deletion but they don't get deleted.
item.content:encoded: It would be great to have an upgraded version of this post for DevOps 2022 onpremise. My DB weights 3tb.. im fighting to shrink it.. i have 2 millions of test results marked for deletion but they don’t get deleted.

item.title: Comment on How to reduce the size of your TFS/Azure DevOps Server collection databases by DP
item.dc:creator: DP
item.description: Do you by chance know what the cleanup SQL commands are for 2022? The database on DevOps doesn't know the stored procedure "prc_CleanupDeletedFileContent". Thanks!
item.content:encoded: Do you by chance know what the cleanup SQL commands are for 2022? The database on DevOps doesn’t know the stored procedure “prc_CleanupDeletedFileContent”. Thanks!

item.title: Comment on Associating automated tests with Azure Test Cases by Sharitha Easwar
item.dc:creator: Sharitha Easwar
item.description:
Can you please post the pipeline details - I am currently getting this error. Exception Message: 149051 is not a valid Build ID or BuildNumber. Make sure that the build succeeded or partially succeeded and is not deleted. (type ReleaseManagementExternalServiceException)
I am using an existing pipeline which is used to run other tests.
item.content:encoded:
Can you please post the pipeline details – I am currently getting this error.
Exception Message: 149051 is not a valid Build ID or BuildNumber. Make sure that the build succeeded or partially succeeded and is not deleted. (type ReleaseManagementExternalServiceException)

I am using an existing pipeline which is used to run other tests.

item.title: Comment on Using Azure Test Plans with Playwright by Ralph
item.dc:creator: Ralph
item.description: Hello, thank you for the post but I have a question about on of the steps. What to do to associate tests cases when working on Mac? Visual Studio on Mac doesn’t have a Test Explorer so the association in a way that is described in the post is not possible. Do you know what might be a way to associate the automated test cases on Mac?
item.content:encoded:
Hello, thank you for the post but I have a question about on of the steps.
What to do to associate tests cases when working on Mac? Visual Studio on Mac doesn’t have a Test Explorer so the association in a way that is described in the post is not possible. Do you know what might be a way to associate the automated test cases on Mac?
